notes.note: QEMU: slirp: OOB buffer access while emulating tcp protocols in tcp_emu()

reference.description: bz#1791551: CVE-2020-7039 QEMU: slirp: OOB buffer access while emulating tcp protocols in tcp_emu()

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

acknowledgment.description: Red Hat would like to thank Vishnu Dev TJ for reporting this issue.

notes.note: QEMU: Slirp: potential OOB access due to unsafe snprintf() usages

reference.description: bz#1798453: CVE-2020-8608 QEMU: Slirp: potential OOB access due to unsafe snprintf() usages

remediation.description:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes
described in this advisory, refer to:
https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

acknowledgment.description: Red Hat would like to thank Laszlo Ersek (redhat.com) for reporting this issue.

note:
An update for qemu-kvm-rhev is now available for Red Hat OpenStack Platform
13 (Queens).
Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact
of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score,
which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability
from the CVE link(s) in the References section.

KVM (Kernel-based Virtual Machine) is a full virtualization solution for
Linux on a variety of architectures. The qemu-kvm-rhev packages provide the
user-space component for running virtual machines that use KVM in
environments managed by Red Hat products.
Security Fix(es):
* Slirp: OOB buffer access while emulating tcp protocols in tcp_emu() (CVE-2020-7039)
* Slirp: potential OOB access due to unsafe snprintf() usages
(CVE-2020-8608)
For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS
score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE
page listed in the References section.
